text: Lake Placid is a village in northern New York State. It has a population of 2,205. It was founded in the early 1880s to look for iron. Today it is a ski resort. It has hosted the Winter Olympics twice, in 1932 and 1980. == References == == Other websites == * Web site of the Lake Placid/Essex County Visitors Bureau * Web site of the Lake Placid News * Lake Placid information * Lake Placid Olympic Authority Category:Olympic cities Category:Ski areas and resorts in the United States
title: Lake Placid, New York
